source.987af1aa:
#Function to choose the right threshold 
def outliersz(z):
    for i in np.arange(3,5,0.2):
        data=df.copy()
        data=data[(z<i).all(axis=1)]
        loss=(df.shape[0]-data.shape[0])/df.shape[0]*100
        print('With threshold {} data loss is {}%'.format(np.round(i,1),np.round(loss,2)))
source.16bd86ca:
#Using zscore method to remove outliers
from scipy.stats import zscore
z=np.abs(zscore(df))
outliersz(z)

source.65af3f3c:
#We import Classification Models
from sklearn.naive_bayes import  GaussianNB
from sklearn.neighbors import KNeighborsClassifier
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeClassifier
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.ensemble import AdaBoostClassifier
from sklearn.ensemble import GradientBoostingClassifier
from xgboost import XGBClassifier
source.00a2b1b2:
#Function to find the best random state
def randomstate(x,y):
    maxx=0
    model=LogisticRegression()
    for i in range(1,201):
        xtrain,xtest,ytrain,ytest=train_test_split(x,y,test_size=0.25,random_state=i)
        model.fit(xtrain,ytrain)
        p=model.predict(xtest)
        accu=accuracy_score(p,ytest)
        if accu>maxx:
            maxx=accu
            j=i
    return j
source.952be876:
#To evakuate performances of all the models
def performance(p,ytest,m,xtest,s):
    print('------------------------------------',m,'------------------------------------')
    print('Accuracy',np.round(accuracy_score(p,ytest),4))
    print('----------------------------------------------------------')
    print('Mean of Cross Validation Score',np.round(s.mean(),4))
    print('----------------------------------------------------------')
    print('AUC_ROC Score',np.round(roc_auc_score(ytest,m.predict_proba(xtest)[:,1]),4))
    print('----------------------------------------------------------')
    print('Confusion Matrix')
    print(confusion_matrix(p,ytest))
    print('----------------------------------------------------------')
    print('Classification Report')
    print(classification_report(p,ytest))
source.248dbe39:
#Creating a list of models which will be created one by one
models=[GaussianNB(),KNeighborsClassifier(),SVC(probability=True),LogisticRegression(),DecisionTreeClassifier(),
        RandomForestClassifier(),AdaBoostClassifier(),GradientBoostingClassifier(),XGBClassifier(verbosity=0)]
source.1a04228f:
#Creates and trains model from the models list
def createmodel(trainx,testx,trainy,testy):
    for i in models:
        model=i
        model.fit(trainx,trainy)
        p=model.predict(testx)
        score=cross_val_score(model,x,y,cv=10)
        performance(p,testy,model,testx,score)

source.6a745b93: ###### Dropping columns constant and identifier columns.
source.5f702bb5: Majority of the employees travel rarely while 10.2% of employees are non travellers.
source.8a058b01: Attrition is very high at low monthly income especially below 5000. As income inreases chances of employee leaving becomes very low,
source.392474b7: Most employees are given percent salary hike in the range of 11 to 15 percent while few are also given hike around 24 to 25 percent. Feature is kewed towards right having mean greater than median.
source.c6509df5: Attrition is maximum in the range 27 to 33. As age increases attrition decreases as people look for stability in their job.
source.fb54c829: Employees get income from 1009 to 19999. Majority of the employees get income around 2500. There are less than 50 employees getting income of the highest level. Data is right skewed with mean greater than the median.
source.21d83ba2: Employees show more attrition at lower daily rate and attrition keeps on decreasing as the daily rate increases and people become economically stable.
source.faed1f8e: As the distance increases attrition decreases in employees showing that employees attrit even if they are at ease.
source.2b984cc7: Divorced employees show more attrition than single or Married ones.
source.c86edcc9: Majority of the employees have Life sciences as there field. There are a lot of employees belonging to medical field as well. Apart from all fields, there is an Other field which may contain employees from rare educational fields.
source.3fb50468: Category 3 people show the highest involment in there job, while category 1 shows least involment, may be they are part time workers.
source.4701fd34: Most of the employees are Married and a lot of them are divorced. Maritial status can also define the age category of an employee as young,middle age and old.
source.448682d8: There is low skewness in the data. Monthly rate range from 2094 to 25999 with number of employees showing very less variance.
source.aee3d208: There are 5 job levels. Oviously high positons have less number of employee, Majority of the employees work in lower levels.
source.78403312: As we can see as the age and years at company increases density of grapgh decreases stating that as age increases very few people remain at the same company. Also high attrition is also seen at higher ages if years at company is less.
source.760c74ee: There is high attrition when a employee is new to the company, new employees tend to change jobs for better pay and better career choices. Attrition is especially high below 5 years. As an eployee works for more than 15 years in a company, chances of him leaving the companny become very steep.
source.b8594bba: There are 4 levels of job satisfaction. Most of the employees are satified with there job but around 569 people show low to satisfactory opinion on there job satisfaction, which is a large number.
source.bdfa0e16: Support Vector Classifier along with ensemble techiques like Random Forest, Gradient Boost and Xtreme Gradient Boost are doing a good job. So lets perform Hyperparameter tuning on these models to see which model is performing the best.
source.3cee88e0: Employees who do not travel on bussinesses tend to attrit more.
source.4e62fe7c: Employees who are involved too much in work or too less tend to attrit more than employees who lie between these ranges.
source.63b50f97: Most of the employees show high levels of environment satisfaction but around 284 employees show very low satisfaction which is quite a big number.
source.62df23ef: There are few outliers present in the continuous data, while a large number of outliers are present in the Monthly incom column.
source.c43bd059: Majority of the employees have there life balance at level 3, there are around 5.4% employees who need to work on this. Only 10.4% employees have there life completely balanced.
source.89f658a2: There is low skewness, data is almost normally distributed. Majority of the employees working have there age in the range 28 to 40. Employees as young as 18 start working in the company and the retirement age seems to be 60.
source.e70357e7: There is high skewness present in some of the columns that is needed to be handled.
source.b56ca39c: As the age increases so does the job level and attrition decreases. Maximum attrition is seen in job level 1 and 3 irrespective of age of the employee/
source.ee41d32c: Dataset is highly imbalance as the label class has only 16.1% of yes and 83.9% of no category.
source.418caac2: Most of the employees train 2 to 3 times a year while no. of employees training rigorously or doing none of the training are very few in numbers.
source.a97907e2: Employees at higher job levels tend to attrit more than who are at lower level.
source.7f7e8f80: The best model for this problem is Extreme Gradient Boost as it gives a good performance also the difference between its accuracy score and mean cross validation score is minimum, which means it will not give high variances in its result.
source.f9b02d18: Most of the employees live less than 3 kms from the office. There are around 100 employees who travel more than 25kms to reach office. Data is highly skewed to the right with mean greater than the median.
source.4e126554: ###### Separating the dependent and independent variables
source.a496d5a4: People with highest level of education has shown more attrition than any other educational level.
source.9df3f55f: Every column has count equal to 1470 signifying no missing values. Mean is not equal to median stating that the data is not normally distributed. Most normally distributes column is Daily rate where mean is almost eqaul to median. Variance is quite low in many columns except for DailyRate which has high variance. Outliers are also present as the min, max, and interquartile ranges have large difference.
source.7c2fba3b: There are 9 job roles. Most of them are of Sales Executive, and only 3.5% are of Human Resources.
source.1dbecdbf: There are no null values in the dataframe
source.5e479f77: Now both the classes in the label class is equal and data is balanced.
source.6e44deca: Income increases with increase in job level and attrition decreases at high job levels.
source.f8d84710: Most of the people are satisfied with there relationship.
source.4bb28aa1: There is no dependency on gender for attrition.
source.95e620ff: Employees in higher levels of stock option show more attrition than eployees in the lower levels.
source.80d486f2: Research Directors show the most attrition followed by Managers and human resources. While the Sales Executives show no attrition.
source.213b1ea0: Employs under Human resources and other education field tend to attrit more than employees belonging to any other educational field.
source.b3f94c3c: There very few loyal employees who have been in the company for more than 30 years. Majority of the employees consist of new employees who have been in the company for only an year. Data is highly skewed. Skewness is towards right.
source.4d085512: As we can see Skewness is removed and is negligible in the continuous data.
source.dd20ac0b: As age increases,monthly income increases and employees have low chances of leaving the company but if monthly income is lower at higher ages then chances of employee leaving the company increases.
source.38388eb7: We choose threhold as 3.4 so that data loss is less than 4% and also there are some outliers we are important for our classification process.
source.2fc6d669: We cannot see correlation of attrition column as it is of object type, we need to encode it first to see its correlation with defferent features. We can also see that there is high correlation between independent features such as (performace rating and percentage salary hike), (total working years and job level) etc, this situation can lead to multicollinearity which we need to take care of.
source.2aff5f11: There are only two categories 3 and 4, it could be that none of the employees have performance in level 1 or 2.
source.ebc8cc02: Employees who train extensively or very less both tend to attrit. While employees training 2 to 3 times a year show no attrition.
source.b2f38821: There are 8 columns with object type data including the label column, rest all the columns have integer type values.
source.75e2f833: There is satisfaction in females even at lower incomes as their attrition decreases after 10000 significantly but males seem to change jobs even after that.
source.45f3b197: Distribution of employees is even for hourly rate. Data foloows gaussian distribution. Hourly rate of employees ranges from 30 to 100.
source.0a3242c7: As Age increases monthly income also increases. Some people work hard and tend to achieve higher incomes at less age also.
source.9e699d5d: Most of the employees are holding very few stocks while the number of employees with highest stocks are very few.
source.56998e5f: Only 28.3% people work overtime, maybe they are in need of money or few number of acquaintances
source.3badadf9: There are 5 categories of Education. Only 3.3% employee hold the highest education qualification. Most of the employees have the education category 3.
source.a9106679: Majority of the employees working are males. There is a 3:2 gender ratio.
source.a6505b75: Single employees at higher income also tend to attrit while married employees do not do so. This is also with the case of Divorced employees after income of 12500 there is no attrition.
source.35357d8b: Employees are working in the company for more than 30 years but the majority of employees working in the company have total years of working in the range 5 to 11 years. Feature shows skeweness which needs to be handles.
source.e92f73b6: Distribution of employees is even for Daily Rate. There is low skewness, data is almost normally distributed. Daily rate of employees range from 102 to 1499.
source.eaa72b27: There are three departments in the company. Most of the employees work in Research & Development department while very few work in the HR department.
source.3aa895a2: There are three columns with only one unique values. So they are not of any use to us. Employee number is also not of any use as it is an identifier column.
